subject: linear_algebra
title: Cholesky Decomposition
contentHtml: The Cholesky decomposition is a factorization of a positive definite matrix A as A = LLᵀ, where L is a lower triangular matrix.
name: Cholesky Decomposition" },
problemHtml: Given the positive definite matrix A = [[4, 12, -16], [12, 37, -50], [-16, -50, 64]], find its Cholesky decomposition.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the diagonal elements of L", "mathHtml": "\[L_{11} = \sqrt{4}\]", "explanation": "Start by finding the square root of the diagonal elements."} ],
finalAnswer: The Cholesky decomposition is A = LLᵀ, where L = [[2, 0, 0], [6, 3, 0], [-8, -10, 4]]." },
intuition: The Cholesky decomposition is useful in machine learning for computing the inverse of a covariance matrix and solving linear systems.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Cholesky Decomposition
contentHtml: The Cholesky decomposition is a factorization of a positive definite matrix A = LLᵀ.
name: Cholesky Decomposition" },
problemHtml:
Find the Cholesky decomposition of the following matrix:

\[\begin{bmatrix}4 & 12 \\ 12 & 40\end{bmatrix}\]",
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Compute the square root of the diagonal elements", "mathHtml": "\(L_{11} = \sqrt{4}\)", "explanation": "We start by finding the square root of the diagonal elements."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Compute the off-diagonal elements using the formula", "mathHtml": "\(L_{12} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{4}}(12)\)", "explanation": "Next, we use the formula to compute the off-diagonal elements."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Assemble the Cholesky decomposition", "mathHtml": "\[L = \begin{bmatrix}\sqrt{4} & 0 \\ \frac{12}{\sqrt{4}} & \sqrt{36}\end{bmatrix}\]", "explanation": "Finally, we assemble the Cholesky decomposition."} ],
intuition: The Cholesky decomposition is useful for solving systems of linear equations and computing the inverse of a matrix.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Cholesky Decomposition
contentHtml: The Cholesky decomposition is a factorization of a symmetric positive definite matrix A into the product LLᵀ, where L is a lower triangular matrix.
name: Cholesky Decomposition" },
problemHtml: Given a positive definite matrix A, compute its Cholesky decomposition L such that A = LLᵀ.
description: Compute the remaining elements of L
explanation: Now, compute the remaining elements of L using the formula above. Note that we only need to consider the elements below the main diagonal." } ],
finalAnswer: The Cholesky decomposition L is computed" },
intuition: The Cholesky decomposition is useful for solving systems of linear equations and computing determinants, as well as in machine learning applications such as Gaussian processes.
